content: Hi everyone, this is James, the lead developer of the ClassicPress fork of WordPress. Lots of forks doing good work these days ;) I got the idea to join here from @Bryan Ollendyke and I'd be happy for us to collaborate or just stay in touch, as I think our respective projects are similar in a lot of ways!

Hi, James Nylen. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
Hi @James Nylen - It's good to hear from you. Welcome to our chat channel.
Would love to hear how things are going with ClassicPress someday.
the short version: we are stable with a small but enthusiastic community, moving forward with plans to grow more, but we need more developers!
Maybe we could schedule a conference call sometime to share experiences and tips for growth.
yeah I'd like that
Yes, we could use more developers as well.
On the other hand, we're pretty proud of what we are accomplishing with the team we have.
same - it turns out, just getting something usable out the door was a huge task! we're working on ecosystem-related tasks this year, like our own plugin directory and translation infrastructure
Yeah, I think it would be great to talk about things like process, structure, and infrastructure.
agreed, let's set up a Zoom sometime
I can image at least 3-4 people in the Backdrop community that would be interested in participating. How about for you?
and these organizing structures would be another piece of why I think this would be useful :)
@Bryan Ollendyke Did you hear us talking about you?

My own self interest -- I think there's tons of UI pieces in both systems that are not platform specific. I've been seeing the gains from sharing reusable web components with government, edu, and the Sakai LMS and I think there's a lot of oppurtunity for things like that here.
yeah at least 3-4 is a good estimate for us too, I guess we can start with a Doodle?
Sure, are you setting one up already or should I?

Web components fundamentally improve web development yet will never get into Drupal bc of React bias (Gutenberg too). My team would be happy to help both communities explore areas where they can be leveraged for small wins in community sites and core platforms as well.
I had tab open @StPaulTim
up late refining my Backdrop and ClassicPress integrations w/ HAX (oddly enough)
go for it and I will share on ClassicPress
I was just going to ask @James Nylen if we should invite you (@Bryan Ollendyke ), but if you set up the Doodle, then guess we don't have a choice. ;-)
I always thought web components would be a good path to a truly open web, but I don't know much about them at the level of implementation details
There are much smarter people than me, that can address the potential role of web components in Backdrop core. But, I'm intrigued.

@James Nylen there's a video on http://hax.camp/ where I lay out what HAX camp is about (actually has a visual at 1 point w/ ClassicPress and Backdrop logos on it). We really didn't talk about HAX much, the event is more about uniting on web components. We had developers from Virginia, Red hat, Michigan, Penn state, Boston library, Duke and Colorado all doing web components in Drupal and other properties, all finally able to have a conversation.

hax.camp
HAXcamp

@James Nylen - one can spin up a demo/sandbox version of Backdrop here in about 45 seconds. If you want to explore a bit: https://backdropcms.org/demo

Do you have anything like this for Classic Press.
@StPaulTim I know that if I can help people get web components implemented in their properties today within the next 2 years you'll adopt HAX cause it's along the road :)
Ah, @Bryan Ollendyke - I misunderstood the open tab to be a Doodle. I'll work on it.
@StPaulTim oh yea, rope me in and I'll see if I can attend.
It would be great to have you there.
@StPaulTim We don't have anything like that, would be nice but a bit outside of our current budget!
I'm pretty sure it's all donated infrastructure and vollunteer time behind that. We'll talk about it.
@James Nylen or @Bryan Ollendyke - Is looking at late next week so soon to have a call?
The 3rd and 4th weeks of March are conferences that some of us will be at.
We could look at the first week of April.
im on a boat next week; any time after that is good for me most likely esp mon/wed/fri
Any of those dates would be fine for me, sounds like first week of April is best for all of us here
I tried to create a doodle last night, but ran into tech problems. Will try again.
